intro: Anomospermum occidentale, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems that store water, making it well adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically alternate and simple. It is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
